Item 5.07 - Submission of Matters to a V.content: On June 10, 2021, Roku, Inc. (“Roku”) held its annual meeting of stockholders via a live webcast (the “Annual Meeting”). At the Annual Meeting, Roku’s stockholders voted on three proposals, each of which is described in more detail in Roku’s definitive proxy statement filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on April 28, 2021 (the “Proxy Statement”). The following is a brief description of each matter voted on and the certified results, including the number of votes cast for and against each matter, and if applicable, the number of abstentions and broker non-votes with respect to each matter.

subsections.Proposal 1: Election of Class I Director:
The Class I director nominees were elected to serve until Roku’s 2024 annual meeting of stockholders and in each case until their successors are elected and qualified or until their earlier death, resignation or removal. The voting results were as follows:

Director Name: Ravi Ahuja
Votes For: 214,062,339
Votes Withheld: 23,906,701
Broker Non-Votes: 23,752,595
Percentage of Votes in Favor: 90.0%

Director Name: Mai Fyfield
Votes For: 217,933,224
Votes Withheld: 20,035,816
Broker Non-Votes: 23,752,595
Percentage of Votes in Favor: 91.6%

Director Name: Laurie Simon Hodrick
Votes For: 237,740,662
Votes Withheld: 228,378
Broker Non-Votes: 23,752,595
Percentage of Votes in Favor: 99.9%
subsections.Proposal 2: Advisory Approval of Executi:
Stockholders approved, on an advisory basis, Roku’s executive compensation as described in the Proxy Statement. The voting results were as follows:

Votes For: 213,493,161
Votes Against: 24,355,473
Abstentions: 120,406
Broker Non-Votes: 23,752,595
Percentage of Votes in Favor: 89.7%
subsections.Proposal 3: Ratification of Independent:
Stockholders ratified the appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP as Roku’s independent registered accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2021. The voting results were as follows:

Votes For: 261,046,968
Votes Against: 512,259
Abstentions: 162,408
Percentage of Votes in Favor: 99.7%
